page.title: 20History of Sth.Benfleet.
page.content:
Anglo_Saxon Chronicle records victory of King Alfred's troops at SB over Danes in AD 894. Haesten's campsite is now car park.A wooden church was probably built as thanksgiving. A Norman church was later built, a beautiful wooden porch added in 15th century and chancel built in perpendicular style. List of vicars goes back to 1189. SB is mentioned in Domesday 1o86 when church and manor were transferred from Barking to Westminster Abbey. To this day,the Vicar does annual duty at Westminster. A smaller manor belonging to Saxon Alwin ran from Thundersley slopes to creek inlet at Hopes Green.{
{This survey was compiled in 1985 by {Lucca Hamer, Anthony Faulkner and {James Evans. }
